column4: why shoul/should not be afraid of third party debian packages?
debian is not ubuntu
deb packages I tried to mean
they can potentially do damage or require dependencies that your system doesn't have or update your system with newer incompatible versions
can deb file erase a file /etc/testfile or write over it?
deb file can do anything - it executed with root permissinos
poit the repo at the cdrom and use the dist-upgrade option
my personal preference is a clean install if possible
more so when moving from non-lts to lts
I am considering if there will be problem with new drivers if they fail to initialize since there are older versions
what is different in non-lts than lts with respect to upgrading from each to other?
no-one cares if you'll buy ati or not again - stop complaining about it
yeah i'm looking for the channel
there isn't one - get a grip please
updating DNS record for the WAN
most dhcp servers will update the dns records when they assign it
well you won't get a performance boost from any message, the dns's servers expire time, cache time will be the deciding factor
right, but I'd like to do the best I can
as I've said there isn't a "best you can" method, do what ever works for you, however the response will depend on the dns server
assume that ttl 60 seconds and the dns server honor that value than there is better i can do in terms of notifying my authoritative dns
not really, and no public dns server would have that value as it would be blacklisted
dyndns subdomains have 60 seconds ttl
